title: Senate Tracker: A Lopsided Race To Fill Big Shoes In Hawaii
teaser: An incumbent Democrat faces a Republican challenger in a special election to fill the seat of former Hawaii senator Daniel Inouye, who died in 2012.
contentencoded:
In this week’s Senate Tracker, we turn to the race in Hawaii, where incumbent Democrat Sen. Brian Schatz faces Republican Campbell “Cam” Cavasso in a special election to fill the seat of Daniel Inouye, a Democrat, who died in 2012.

At 88, Inouye was the most senior member of the Senate and a World War II veteran.

Wayne Yoshioka of Hawaii Public Radio spoke with Here & Now‘s Jeremy Hobson about the race.

  • More in the Senate Tracker series

Guest

  • Wayne Yoshioka, reporter for Hawaii Public Radio. He tweets @wayneyoshioka.
